newsitem.title: UK: Storehouse shares gain after H1 results.
newsitem.headline: Storehouse shares gain after H1 results.

text.p: Shares in Britain's Storehouse Plc rose in early trading on Thursday after the retail group posted a 13 percent rise in underlying first-half profits, with margins up, and said it had an "encouraging" start to the second half.
The stock was up 7-1/2p at 277 by 0806 GMT, after on November 19 hitting its lowest level since July last year.
Pre-tax profit before exceptionsls rose to 37.5 millin stg from 33.3 million a year before and the interim dividend was raised 10 percent to 3.3p.
"Although the main Christmas trading period has yet to begin, the first five weeks of the second half have been encouraging," said chief executive Keith Edelman.
"We have set ourselves ambitious sales and profit targets and at this stage I have every confidence that we shall achieve them."
The company said sales in its Bhs unit rose nine percent, reflecting like-for-like sales growth and new store openings, and UK gross margins were ahead of the year before.
